page.title: 03BROADWAY CHURCH
page.content: Broadway church is \ a mile North of the village, because the original homes were abandoned because of the plagues in 1593-1609 and again in 1666-1667.Some of the stones of these houses were used to build houses in the new village of Broadway which grew up after the plagues. Originally there was a wooden Saxon church,and the church is dedicated to 2 Saxon saints,but the earliest features of the present hamstone church are of the 13th century;the Chancel and Transepts. The Nave and Tower are of the 15th century.The Tower has a set of 5 bells,the oldest bell is dated 1583A.D. The black oak pulpit and the stone font are probably both of the 15th century. Broadway church choir has 8 people. There is a service weekly,mornings and evenings alternately.
